conditions.name: SRC Safety Review for Dose Titration
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee (SRC) must review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant before titration to 30 mg/day.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Adaptive Outpatient Period Extension
conditions.description: The Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended for up to 14 additional days with Investigator approval.
conditions.text: To ensure flexibility, the Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

conditions.name: ALT Elevation (Moderate)
conditions.description: ALT is greater than 3 times and less than or equal to 5 times the upper limit of normal.

conditions.name: ALT Elevation (Severe)
conditions.description: ALT is greater than 5 times the upper limit of normal.

conditions.name: Neutropenia
conditions.description: Neutrophils decrease more than 30% from baseline and are below the reference range.
conditions.text: > 30% ↓ from baseline Neutrophils below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Potential Liver Injury (Hy's Law)
conditions.description: Bilirubin is greater than 2 times ULN accompanied by ALT greater than 3 times ULN.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN, indicative of liver injury

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Pregnancy
conditions.description: Participant becomes pregnant or plans to become pregnant.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30 mg/day
transitionRules.text: Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day for a treatment period of approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29. Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Moderate ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT > 3x ULN and <= 5x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD when ALT is below 2x ULN.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe ALT Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT > 5x ULN, definitively discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: If neutrophils decrease >30% from baseline and are below reference range, reduce dose to previous level or to 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Potential Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN with ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge requires Alexion Medical Monitor approval.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic Worsening
transitionRules.text: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease) based on copper control parameters and relevant clinical data.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Serious Hypersensitivity
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if a serious hypersensitivity reaction occurs.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Severe Infection
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if a severe uncontrolled infection occurs.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Disallowed Medication
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for use of disallowed medication.

transitionRules.name: Intervention Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal by Request
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site after multiple documented attempts.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point on Day 29 to titrate dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day, contingent on SRC safety review.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Safety-Based Dose Modification
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing decisions to modify, interrupt, or discontinue dosing based on safety assessments (liver function, hematology, neurologic, and psychiatric status).

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Outpatient Period Extension Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Investigator decision to extend the outpatient period for up to 14 days.
